pageContext.claim: “We have Gary Cohn who's the president of Goldman Sachs. That's somebody. He's the president of Goldman Sachs. He had to pay over $200 million in taxes to take the job, right?”
pageContext.analysis: Cohn sold $200 million of stock before joing the Trump administration -- and he's been able to take advantage of a rule for White House appointees that allows for defering taxes.
